snippet: The sight of racewalkers apparently flouting the rules can lead to howls from the public and the news media, with calls for racewalking to be thrown out of the Olympics.
abstract: Slow-motion instant replay of television cameras often show racewalkers with both feet in the air, a clear flouting of the rules that is hard to spot in person; the infraction can lead to howls from the public and the news media, with calls for racewalking to be thrown out of the Olympics.
lead_paragraph: The sight of racewalkers apparently flouting the rules can lead to howls from the public and the news media, with calls for racewalking to be thrown out of the Olympics.

headline.seo: Olympic Racewalking Is More Complicated Than It Seems
headline.main: One Step at a Time? It’s More Complicated Than That
headline.print_headline: One Step at a Time? It’s More Complicated Than That
